alert.note: Alert for Dundy; Hitchcock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 6:08PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Hitchcock and northeastern Dundy Counties through 545 PM MDT/645 PM CDT/... At 508 PM MDT/608 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles southwest of Enders Reservoir State Recreation Area, or 11 miles south of Imperial, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Hitchcock and northeastern Dundy Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
